intro: Hieracium verbascifolium subsp. verbascifolium, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and yellow flower heads that resemble dandelions. Native to parts of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other sunny, well-drained areas.
